adr_address: 5 Rue Aristide Bruant, 75018 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Unassuming hotel offering basic rooms with free Wi-Fi & en suite bathrooms, with breakfast option.

name: Hotel korner montmartre

reviews.text:
My daughter and I stayed here for two nights at the beginning of June and had a lovely experience. While the room was small, it was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the shower worked well. There’s no air conditioning, but it wasn’t needed during our stay. Fans are available if required.

The elevator was a welcome bonus, especially since the stairs are quite narrow.

We really appreciated the common area, where we could prepare our own breakfast and relax with a book or an extra cup of coffee. The courtyard was another pleasant spot to unwind.

The location is superb—very close to the Metro and surrounded by a great selection of food options.

We enjoyed our stay so much that we returned for another two nights at the end of our trip. Once again, the staff were very accommodating, allowing us to store our luggage at the office until our departure for the airport.

The staff and the location were great. The rooms look smart and modern but my first room had flies in the bathroom and bedroom so I was moved the next day. My second room had cracked floors and a cracked shower tray. You could hear the drains dripping and flushing all night from the shower plug so I closed the bathroom door. When I opened it each morning the bathroom smelt of sewage. As it was on the ground floor, the walls were thin and the corridor doors were kept open, so I was woken in the morning by other guests moving around/having breakfast. Whilst the staff were lovely and it looks great as you walk in, for these reasons, I wouldn’t stay again.

My husband and I recently enjoyed a pleasant stay at the Korner Hotel in the heart of Montmartre, and we found it to be a fantastic choice for the price.
The reception area is open and modern, immediately creating a welcoming atmosphere. A real highlight was the thoughtful offering of free tea, coffee, and water all day, along with pain au chocolat and croissants - a lovely touch for guests coming and going.
The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. When we checked in, the guy at the desk went above and beyond by proactively changing our room from the ground floor to a higher level, suggesting the upper rooms were nicer. We were placed on the 3rd floor. Our room was small, as is typical for Paris, but we had plenty of space to move around. It was well-equipped with chargers on each side of the bed, places to hang clothes, a desk, and a TV. We noted the absence of a safe and air conditioning, but neither bothered us during our September visit.
The most important feature for a good trip is sleep, and the bed was really comfortable with soft bedding, ensuring we both had a great night's rest.
The bathroom was clean and modern. Being on the third floor, the shower took a little while to warm up, but once it did, it was lovely with great pressure.
There are a couple of points for light sleepers to bear in mind: the walls are thin, so you can hear people coming and going on your floor. Additionally, the maid service can start early and be noisy. We came prepared and took ear plugs, which meant neither issue disturbed our sleep.
Overall, the hotel was great value for the price we paid. However, a friend who was assigned our original ground-floor room had a less positive experience. Based on this, I would strongly recommend requesting a room on a higher floor upon booking, as rooms on the ground floor or basement are apparently much noisier.
We had a lovely stay and would recommend the Korner Hotel for a central location in Montmartre. While we likely won't return, only because we'd like to experience a different area of Paris next time, the hotel itself provided a comfortable and good value stay.

Pros: excellent location, complimentary tea/coffee/juice/water, kept our bags before check-in so we could explore the city and same with after checking out.

Cons: make sure to request a room on a higher floor, we got a basement room and it wasn’t great. There’s no air-con in the hotel and the basement was hot. It averaged around 20 degrees (Celsius) during our stay so I can’t imagine how uncomfortable it would get at the height of summer. Our two large windows opened directly onto the hotel’s courtyard that could be accessed by any guest, and there was no safety lock on the windows; if we wanted some fresh air, they had to be fully open which obviously is not safe at all. On their website it says they offer fans; unfortunately, that’s not true. When we asked for one, receptionist told us she doesn’t know why the website says that and that she had no fans to give us. This is also despite there being a fan (not in use) on the receptionist’s desk - she told us she couldn’t let us use it as it belonged to her colleague.
The rooms are very small, but this was fine for us only staying for a few days.
There’s mold in the bathroom, I’m assuming due in part to the issue with the window and poor ventilation.

I had an amazing stay at Hotel Korner Montmartre! The location is super convenient — just a short walk to Montmartre and really easy to get to other parts of Paris by metro. The area feels safe and lively, with plenty of cafes and shops around. The rooms are simple but very comfortable and clean, and honestly, great value for the price. Greetings from Lithuania!
